title: Using Replit
text: To use replit, we can go to this website replit.com Here we have to simply click on login After clicking on login, we can sign up for ourselves and we can set up an account for ourselves where we can sign up with any of our gmail accounts Once our replit account is created, our homepage will look like this Now if we want to write C++ code on replit and execute it then for that we have to go to this create repl We will click on this and in our favorites we can choose C++ So we will click on C++ If we can't see the option of CPP, then we can also search for C++ and then we can give any title for ourselves Let's give our title I am going to give it a title of Apna College Basically we are giving this title for our folder So I am giving my folder the name Apna College and I am going to create this repl So now we are in Apna College and automatically replit will create a file named main.cpp for us .cpp is showing that this file is C++ and where is this file? This file is here and this basic C++ code is also open for us I am going to delete all of this code and I am going to show you my sample code in this We are going to start with hash include We are going to start with hash include Iostream using namespace std int main cout apna college return 0 Now this basic code, what does it mean? We will not talk about it now, we will learn it in detail But I have written a general C++ code which is very basic and its function is to print Apna College on the screen So to run this code I can simply click on this run button Code will run and Apna College will be printed on the screen We can also see how much time it took to execute that code But while learning DSA, our major work will be to write code and at the end of the code, something or the other will be printed on the screen So in this way, whatever code we are writing on our laptop in Visual Studio Code All that code can be written on replit without installing anything But once again, this is just a temporary solution As a professional programmer, our priority should be to download Visual Studio Code and practice all our DAC on it But temporarily, we can also write our code on replit and run it

chunks.title: Using Replit
chunks.text: To use replit, we can go to this website replit.com

chunks.title: Using Replit
chunks.text: Here we have to simply click on login

chunks.title: Using Replit
chunks.text: After clicking on login, we can sign up for ourselves

chunks.title: Using Replit
chunks.text: and we can set up an account for ourselves

chunks.title: Using Replit
chunks.text: where we can sign up with any of our gmail accounts

chunks.title: Using Replit
chunks.text: Once our replit account is created, our homepage will look like this

chunks.title: Using Replit
chunks.text: Now if we want to write C++ code on replit and execute it

chunks.title: Using Replit
chunks.text: then for that we have to go to this create repl

chunks.title: Using Replit
chunks.text: We will click on this and in our favorites we can choose C++

chunks.title: Using Replit
chunks.text: So we will click on C++

chunks.title: Using Replit
chunks.text: If we can't see the option of CPP, then we can also search for C++

chunks.title: Using Replit
chunks.text: and then we can give any title for ourselves

chunks.title: Using Replit
chunks.text: Let's give our title

chunks.title: Using Replit
chunks.text: I am going to give it a title of Apna College

chunks.title: Using Replit
chunks.text: Basically we are giving this title for our folder

chunks.title: Using Replit
chunks.text: So I am giving my folder the name Apna College

chunks.title: Using Replit
chunks.text: and I am going to create this repl

chunks.title: Using Replit
chunks.text: So now we are in Apna College

chunks.title: Using Replit
chunks.text: and automatically replit will create a file named main.cpp for us

chunks.title: Using Replit
chunks.text: .cpp is showing that this file is C++

chunks.title: Using Replit
chunks.text: and where is this file?

chunks.title: Using Replit
chunks.text: This file is here and this basic C++ code is also open for us

chunks.title: Using Replit
chunks.text: I am going to delete all of this code

chunks.title: Using Replit
chunks.text: and I am going to show you my sample code in this

chunks.title: Using Replit
chunks.text: We are going to start with hash include

chunks.text: We are going to start with hash include

chunks.title: Using Replit

chunks.title: Using Replit
chunks.text: Now this basic code, what does it mean?

chunks.title: Using Replit

chunks.title: Using Replit
chunks.text: But I have written a general C++ code

chunks.title: Using Replit

chunks.title: Using Replit
chunks.text: So to run this code

chunks.title: Using Replit

chunks.title: Using Replit

chunks.title: Using Replit

chunks.title: Using Replit
